newsitem.title: JAPAN: Bank of Japan drains 400 bln yen from market.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Japan drains 400 bln yen from market.

text.p: The Bank of Japan (BOJ) drained a net 400 billion yen from the money market on Friday, money traders said.
The BOJ maintained its accommodative credit stance on Friday as the drainage left the market in surplus by about 100 billion yen, traders said.
The BOJ offered to sell 400 billion yen in bills through an auction for settlement on Friday in an agreement ending at 1.00 p.m. (0400 GMT) today. --- Tokyo Treasury Desk +81-33432-8570
